Instruction: In a saucepan, combine wild rice and water or vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 40-45 minutes, or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add diced celery and carrot to the skillet and sauté until slightly softened, about 5-7 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine cooked wild rice, sautéed celery and carrot, goji berries, sliced green onion, and chopped parsley.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve warm as a flavorful and nutritious side dish.
